name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Orlando - Lake Buena Vista

reviews.text: Great value; nice place and nice location; staff is friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Buses to each Disney venue run every half hour. Having a suite made this trip with my family feel more relaxing.
reviews.title: Disney Village Doubletree

reviews.text: I've stayed at Doubletrees before and found their quality rather hit and miss.
reviews.title: Good place to sleep if you're planning on spending most of your time at the parks

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful, check in was fast and painless.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: They are currently painting the outside of the building so the regular path to the pool was closed, as was the patio my first floor room had.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Since we had small kids we decided to drive to the parks and pay for parking instead of using the shuttle bus. It's right next to Downtown Disney though and only a few minutes to each of the parks.
reviews.title: Downtown Disney Trip

reviews.text: It's hard to beat the value for the accommodations at the DoubleTree. All rooms are suites and this location is ideal for getting to downtown Disney, Parks, Paradise Island, or to the rest of Orlando. The staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: best option for a disney trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice accomodations- upgraded to King. Staff provided meal after restaurant was closed. Friendly and welcoming staff. It was our engagement wknd and they made it special with wine/cheese tray/ballons. Thank you
reviews.title: Doubletree Hilton Hotel Disney World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent trip involved staying in Orlando for a few nights, going on a cruise, then returning to Orlando for a few more nights before going home. I booked this hotel for before and after the cruise, but cancelled the 'after' booking before leaving for the cruise.
reviews.title: Tired!

reviews.text: The rooms here are huge. It's like having the equivalent of two rooms, in most hotels. There's a living area and a bedroom area, each occupying the space that one room often occupies.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Families

reviews.text: The decor and furnishings were very tired and dated. The fridge seemed to be on it's last legs. The bathroom was well used. The view from the windows was bleak - a crane that was being used to paint the outside of the hotel was right in front of it.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: My wife, her best friend, and myself ducked down to Orlando to catch the Black Crowes at the House of Blues in Downtown Disney. We had requested a room with a patio and were excited to find out when we arrived that they could accomodate us. Our room was huge, clean, and had a slider to a nice covered patio. While the slider was a bit tough to open, we thoroughly enjoyed access right to the game room, outdoor pool table, and pool. However, it poured the entire time we were there so we never actually were able to hang out at the pool. The grounds are nice, and I thought the pool area was pretty decent, I only wished I was able to spend an afternoon there. I did drop a few bucks in the game room on some old school games like Pacman, Star Wars, and Donkey Kong. Good times. We also took some drinks out to the pool table after the show and played a few games. Security walked by but never bothered us. We never ate at the hotel but we did use our free drink coupons at the bar. The only issue we felt was the bartender. She was slooooow. We each got one drink and while we sat there we noticed that a bunch of families had some in and wanted drinks and food. Well, for a while, the bartender couldn't even be found. Some of the folks grabbed their own menus. That said, the folks at the front desk were super helpful and extremely nice. Big ups to them. I'd definitely stay at this location again. It's a quick walk to downtown Disney for nightlife and restaurants and they even run a shuttle if you're not inclined to walk it.
reviews.title: Super Nice Staff....Great Stay

reviews.text: We love staying at this Doubletree because the staff is always so helpful and attentive. There is definitely a Disney feel even though this isn't actually a Disney property. From the valet to front desk to housekeeping the staff are courteous and professional. The rooms are spacious enough for us and our 3 kids (ages 11, 8 & 6), there is a table for eating, a small fridge & microwave for breakfast meals and snacks.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay as a Family

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and very friendly. Staff was knowledgeable of the area and took the time to make sure questions were answered. Fantastic stay with shuttle to Disney. We are planning an other visit to this hotel. If there is anything negitive it would be the older style of furniture. But even though it's outdated furniture it still is clean and in good working condition.
reviews.title: Family visit to Disney

reviews.text: Mid February I stayed at this hotel with my husband. He was on business, I was on pleasure. The pool was closed for renovations which although disappointing, ended up not being a big deal because the weather wasn't fabulous. See my other review for details.
reviews.title: Second stay in six weeks...different opinion!

reviews.text: THIS time, my four kids and I accompanied my husband on business. While my husband and son continued on down to Miami, my girls and I stayed and did Disney for a few days. We used the hotel transportation daily. It got us TO the parks wonderfully. We literally walked onto a bus each morning, took it to which ever park it stopped at first and either stayed there or took Disney transportation to a different park. Perfect. Getting BACK at the end of the night wasn't so smooth. One night we had to wait over an hour for it and then endure a long bus ride back as it stopped at other parks and hotels, and both other nights it was incredibly crowded.
reviews.title: Alternate Lodging

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. If you are going to Disney it is perfect in terms of location. It is a 5 min walk to Downtown Disney and a 10 min drive to the Disney parks. The shuttles to Disney picks up right outside the main entrance. It was clean and quiet at night. The beds were comfortable. Our room had 2 doubles plus a sofa bed. We had 4 adults and 4 kids in one room and it was comfortable. They also have yummy cookies that are free at the front desk. They have a breakfast buffet but it is expensive at 17.00 per person so we had take away egg sandwiches for 5.00 and they have assorted sticky pastries. They also have a small sundries shop as well. Only down side is the 13.00 per day to park your car. They have a pool and fitness room but we did not have a chance to use them.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Great Hotel - Great Location - Perfect room size - buses were clean and on time. You do have to pay for parking so take advantage of the buses. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Great Deal - Great Stay!
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay in disney. Same convenience as the Disney Hotels, at half the price. The pool was clean, the rooms are very large, the beds are extremely confortable, room was clean, food in the restauant was good (especially breakfast). The staff was helpful as well. We wont stay anywhere else in disney after this trip. I usually stay at a disney hotel, but this was a much better deal. Having a suite with young kids is priceless....Gave the adults some "wine time" in the evenings.

Nice hotel, had room issue but had to accept plan B. Within walking distance of Downtown Disney, was on Disney bus shuttle so VERY convenient. Staff was very accomodating. We would stay again without hesitation, but will make sure room is what we had requested.
reviews.title: Hilton Double Tree- Downtown Disney

reviews.text: We stayed here as a family b/c my daughter had a HS trip to attend a conference and it was also the weekend of her 16th b'day, so a combined work/fun long weekend. The hotel is SO WELL LOCATED, just off the highway, but it feels "nestled away"...just off Lake Buena Vista Drive which takes you to EVERYTHING DISNEY, but still feels "off the beaten path". The hotel feels a tiny bit "yesteryear" in decor, but well maintained and pristinely lean. The b'fast buffet suits all palates, from the health food nut to the junk-food junkie. We were unable to enjoy the many amenities offered, b/c we left early and arrived home late each night, but the pool and the workout facilities are wonderful and very clean. We forgot to bring a few things and the lobby stores solved our problems easily. The hotel brought up balloons and a treat (those amazing cookies!) for a b'day surprise for my daughter, which we REALLY APPRECIATED (I only mentioned that it was going to be her b'day one time, so I was really impressed)! Thanks to all...front desk, concierge, gift shop, and especially servers in restaurant and room service...for making us feel so at home and having another terrific DoubleTree experience! I've stayed at "nicer/newer" Doubletrees, but this property competes easily and please know my recommendation is to "stay here w/ confidence"--even if it is not the "newest" hotel on the block!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Partner and I stayed here for 2 nights in September then 3 nights in December. We go to Orlando approx 6 times a year and tend to stay in the Downtown Disney area as the Disney Resort hotels, which I love, are so expensive. This property is clean, very well priced and since it's a suite you get a lot of room. Front desk staff is friendly and efficient. There is a restaurant and bar which we didn't use (and it looked like very few people do). Parking is about $11 per day. At one point we were leaving to go to dinner and there was a very large group of high school age young guys checking in (apparently a sports team). I was concerned about potential noise from a bunch of young guys but we never saw or heard them again. You can hear a little noise from the hallways in the morning but that's due to young kids excited about going to the parks (happens at most hotels in Orlando) and wasn't too bad. We did notice the first time we were in a room that was of a different configuration than the second time (1st time suite was very square, 2nd very rectangular and with much less natural light). There is a mini fridge, microwave and sink in the living area, but no plates or utensils so if you bring in any food you may want to pick up some paper or plastic plates, etc. We will almost definitely return on our next trip to see the mouse.
reviews.title: Lots of room, reasonably priced
Clean, Spacious accommodation in downtown Disney area
reviews.text: Stayed with family over christmas. Accommodation was spacious with two double beds and a living room. Continetal breakfast was adequate. We upgraded to full breakfast on 2 days. Omlettes were really good. Buses to Disney parks were frequent. Swimming pool was clean and warm. Coin operated laundry is available, useful for families. Wifi is free in public areas. Gym was clean and useful on cold days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Orlando on Christmas Eve before the madness of the Magic Kingdom on Christmas Day. We were greeted with the warm cookies that this brand is known for. I loved the two room suite. The seating area is comfortable, there is a nice table and chairs for dining in the room, which we considered, because we were exhausted from the park hopping during the day. We went downstairs and ate at the cafe' and it was delicious. We both had sandwiches, and both were remarkable. I returned to the front desk for a bandaid after dinner, and while they were retrieving it, I remarked how much we enjoyed the cookies. They gave me a can of 6. How wonderful on Christmas Eve to be the ones eating the cookies! Thanks for a great stay!
reviews.title: Best Cookies on Christmas Eve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location close to Downtown Disney, good service, stayed two nights, have to pay for parking which was not mentioned on the web-site prior to check-in, hallway noise from kids running was loud but room was nice. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Great value, great location with Disney bus service to parks

reviews.text: Decent hotel for the price we got it for. Shuttles to the disney resorts are a major plus. No rental car really needed unless you want to go to Universal or others. Staff was friendly and the warm cookie at check in was so good. Rooms are average, the room we had must of had a thermostat issue, as we didn't get any heat until we turned it up to almost 90. We also had one day that our room did not get serviced so we didn't have any towels or cups for the next day, was disappointed that we had to call for those things. But overall decent place good breakfast buffet, a little expensive but shuttles to the resorts are nice. Will probably stay elsewhere for a little more comfort.
reviews.title: Good rates, friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights a few days before Christmas, I was surprised at the value. We had a two room suite comprising of a small kitchen area with microwave, sink, fridge, & coffee maker. It was a 13 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Good location, no resort fee and decent value we will stay here again
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Stayed for just one night. Did Sea World one day and Magic Kingdom the next. This Doubletree was in the perfect location for us to have a short drive to both parks. There are five of us so a suite was perfect - 2 double beds and a sofa bed. Booked it through MouseSavers and got a great rate that included breakfast for 2 adults and 2 kids, but they gave us all 5 breakfasts for free. Would stay there again. Loved it!
reviews.title: Perfect base for Family of 5 for Orlando Attractions

reviews.text: Great location in the Disney village. Very friendly staff and clean family friendly hotel! Giant rooms with dividers and multiple beds, couches, and ameneties.Has a lot to do for kids and adults. Some parts of the hotel could use updating as far as carpet. Only negative was the $11 a day parking fee. Otherwise I would stay here every time I visit the area.
reviews.title: Big suites with amazing customer service!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Double Tree for a Conference. I travel often and have attended hundreds of business conferences. The hotel conference staff at the DoubleTree was the best ever. Louree' Jefferson was the best. She greated everyone with open arms and was extremely hospitable. I was amazed by the entire staff and how warm, friendly and accomodating they were. I will recommend the DoubleTree for other conferences in Orlando.
reviews.title: Great Conference

reviews.text: The hotel room was dated and the carpeting smelled of mildew/mold. The room was not cleaned thoroughly; the tub and the sink were dirty. However, the location is fairly close to WDW - about a 45 minute bus ride, and it was less expensive than staying in a Disney hotel.
reviews.title: Dated rooms with carpeting that smells of mildew. The room was not cleaned thoroughly.

reviews.text: Great location and can get to most major attractions quickly by Taxi. Now some of the rooms do not seem that upscale as compared some other Disney properties but it has all of the amenities and what a traveler needs.
reviews.title: Great service can and close to most attractions.

reviews.text: stayed there twice this year, suites are great if you are traveling with kids or other in your party, hotel property has transportation to all parks.
reviews.title: great stay hotel has everything

reviews.text: Resturant has very good food and bartender is friendly
reviews.title: Nice for families

reviews.text: parking is 11 dollars a night
reviews.title: Very nice, great service and location

reviews.text: location is also close to mall and lots of resturants.
reviews.title: Great place to meet!

reviews.text: The hotel was amazing in general like other DoubleTree's. There was a Disney store in the hotel which was cool. They welcomed us with a cookie, which I found surprising since it was my first time in a DoubleTree and I did not except that. This was a long time ago, so the hotel looked a bit different but had that feel to it. The beds were comfy and room was clean. Close to Disney World and loved it. Even when we checked out, the manager was there and gave our family each a cookie again!!! Wonderful service, and I will come back here again hopefully in the future.
reviews.title: COOKIES!!!

reviews.text: My family & I stayed here over the weekend as we went to Walt Dsiney World last Saturday. The hotel is in a great spot just off the interstate and close to many restaurants and shops. Check in was fast and friendly, and since we are diamond members, we got all of the usual perks that go along with that.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our 20 month old with us and her grand mother, so we had adjoining rooms (which are all suites) and the setup was perfect. The rooms are spacious and have a kitchen table, coffee maker, and microwave. One downfall was that we were supposed to already have a pack and play set up in the room, and it wasn't there when we went in, so we had to call twice to get it sent up.
reviews.title: Mini-cation in Orlando

reviews.text: We used the pool the first day and it was very nice. The water is heated and they have a main pool, kids pool and playground and hot tub. Also, if you are travelling with older kids, there is a game room and pool table.
reviews.title: Nice accommodations, however pricey breakfast

reviews.text: We ate the continental breakfast both days and it plenty to offer-- fruit, cereals, oatmeal, and muffins. You can upgrade to the hot breakfast, which looked good as well.
reviews.title: Right for the Price

aka: Doubletree Suites By Hilton In The Walt Disney World Hotel Orlando
description: Contemporary All-Suite Resort Hotel located in Walt Disney World Resort.
